description: Try our easy to follow Crispy Hoisin Pork With Onion Pancakes recipe. Absolutely delicious with the best ingredients from Woolworths.
keywords: Savoury pancake,Low saturated fat,High protein,Seafood free,Tree nut free,Egg free,Pork,Low sugar,Dairy free
name: Crispy Hoisin Pork With Onion Pancakes Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 1 green capsicum, deseeded, cut into thin strips
1 long red chilli, deseeded, finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Place flour and salt in a bowl. Add 2/3 cup warm water, 1 tbs of vegetable oil and 2 tsp sesame oil and mix well to combine. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 5 minutes or until smooth. Place in a clean bowl and cover with a tea towel. Set aside for 30 minutes (see tip).

Divide dough into 12 even pieces. Roll each one out to a 12cm round. Working with one round at a time, brush top side with a little extra sesame oil and top with some of the spring onion. Roll up tightly then using your palms, roll on the bench to make a long thin rope. Roll into a coil and press to flatten. Roll out to a 12 cm round. Repeat again.

Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Brush with vegetable oil to lightly grease. Cook pancakes for 1 minute each side or until golden. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil to keep warm. Repeat with remaining pancakes.
Heat 1 tbs vegetable oil in a frying pan or wok over high heat. Add pork strips and cook for 5 minutes, tossing frequently, until crisp. Stir in hoisin sauce and toss well to coat. Keep warm.
Serve pancakes topped with vegetables, pork and chilli and garnished with coriander.
